title: Search Bar
description: Effortless search integration with Contentlayer and regex-based highlighting.

body.raw: # No-Setup Search Bar üöÄ One of the coolest things about **Pinexio** is its built-in search functionality. Thanks to **Contentlayer**, there is absolutely **no additional setup** required. Any `.mdx` file inside the `docs/` folder is automatically indexed and searchable. That means **no third-party libraries**, no extra indexing steps, and no configuration‚Äîjust write your documentation, and it‚Äôs instantly searchable! ## üîç How It Works The logic for searching and highlighting results is handled inside the **`SearchDialog`** component. Here‚Äôs how it works: 1. **Regex-based search**: The search input filters through all `.mdx` files and highlights matching text. 2. **Instant results**: Matches appear as you type, making navigation seamless. 3. **Keyboard shortcut support**: Press `Cmd + K` (Mac) or `Ctrl + K` (Windows/Linux) to open the search box instantly. 4. **Highlighted snippets**: The searched term is highlighted within the results. ## ‚ú® Key Features - **üìÇ No Configuration Needed** ‚Äì Contentlayer automatically makes all `.mdx` files searchable. - **‚ö° Instant Search** ‚Äì Type in the search box, and relevant results appear immediately. - **üé® Customizable Highlighting** ‚Äì The `highlightText` function ensures matched keywords stand out. - **‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Shortcuts** ‚Äì Quick access using `Cmd + K` or `Ctrl + K`. - **üìå Contextual Snippets** ‚Äì The `getSnippet` function provides relevant text around the search term. ## üõ† Customization Developers can tweak the search experience by modifying: - `highlightText(text, searchTerm)`: Controls how search terms are highlighted. - `getSnippet(text, searchTerm, contextLength)`: Adjusts how much surrounding text is shown in results. - Styling: The UI is fully customizable with Tailwind CSS. ## üîß Code Snippet: Search Highlighting ```tsx function highlightText(text: string, searchTerm: string): React.ReactNode { if (!searchTerm) return text; const regex = new RegExp(`(${searchTerm})`, 'gi'); const parts = text.split(regex); return ( <> {parts.map((part, i) => regex.test(part) ? ( {part} ) : ( part ) )} ); } ``` ## üì∑ Visual Preview ![Search Bar Demo](#) ## üéØ Why This is Cool - **Developers don‚Äôt need to learn anything new**‚Äîjust write documentation, and it‚Äôs searchable. - **No indexing or database setup required**‚ÄîContentlayer handles everything automatically. - **Regex-based highlighting provides accurate and readable results**. - **Easily customizable for advanced search experiences**. This makes **Pinexio‚Äô search a true "No-Setup Search" solution**, saving time and effort while delivering a powerful experience for users. --- Want to enhance search further? Feel free to tweak the `SearchDialog` component to add fuzzy search, filters, or UI improvements. üöÄ
